definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to take charge of/to manage/department (under a ministry)

sentences.english: Maybe it's a cashmere cardigan without buttons.
sentences.chinese: 也許這會是一件沒有釦子的開司米羊毛衫。

sentences.english: Wools, cashmeres, and light colored silks.
sentences.chinese: 羊毛，開司米還有淺色絲綢。

sentences.english: Material incluedes cotton, polyester, cashmere, nylon and bamboo fiber and so on.
sentences.chinese: 棉，滌綸，開司米，尼龍，竹纖維等。

sentences.english: These countries produce a type of cashmere silk woven carpets cheaper than those from China.
sentences.chinese: 這些國家生產一種開司米絲織的地毯比中國的便宜。

sentences.english: Cashmere is valued for the soft less(its softness) and warmth without much wet(weight).
sentences.chinese: 開司米的價值在於它的柔軟和暖和，並且不重。

sentences.english: We buy a cashmere cardigan as a substitute for the counsel of friends.
sentences.chinese: 我們買一件開司米毛衣代替朋友的忠告。
